result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Martin Nolan Loth Jesion

records.addlTxt: for Adjournment of Trial
Defendant's Notice of Alibi

10:41 AM Defendant Martin Nolan Loth Jesion appeared by phone.  Attorney Brett Tyler Kaehne appeared by phone for Martin Nolan Loth Jesion.  Attorney Joel N Urmanski in court for State of Wisconsin. 
950/Marsy's Law complied with. 
Victim by phone and makes statement to the Court.
Atty Kaehne - absolutely no negotiations or communications have been made on the case and prepared to proceed to Trial.
DA Urmanski will do everything he can to try to proceed with Trial, but notes other Trials scheduled for next week.
Court puts on the record that MIL named the victim by name so the Court had them sealed.
Atty Kaehne would like to proceed with Motions today, does not believe that this case will resolve and would like to set a deadline for State's Witness list.
As to Defense Motions in Limine - 
#1 - No objections.
#2 - Defense should have everything that State does. 
#3 - State reqeusts to mainain under advisement. Atty Kaehne does not object
#5 - Same request for same reasons
No expert testimony expected at this time. 
No objection to sequestration, other than Victim's under Marsy's Law. Court has no discretion. Atty Kaehne agrees with Court.
#8 - Witness List to be filed as soon as possible. DA Urmanski states he should have it finished by tomorrow and will email to Atty Kaehne.
State requests to be able to refer to victim as victim during closing argument.
Impeachment evidence to be disclosed.
Court will require Jury Instructions on day of Trial and preliminary the day before.
Court will carry 1 1/2 panels of Jurors.
Note from the Judge to seal Defense's MIL

9:33 AM Attorney Brett Tyler Kaehne appeared by phone for Martin Nolan Loth Jesion.  Attorney Joel N Urmanski in court for State of Wisconsin.
